reclaim.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to get back an amount of money that you have paid
reclaim.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: You may be entitled to reclaim some tax.
reclaim.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make an area of desert, wet land etc suitable for farming or building
reclaim.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: This land will be reclaimed for a new airport.
reclaim.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to get back something that you have lost or that has been taken away from you
reclaim.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I want to reclaim the championship that I lost in 1999.
reclaim.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to obtain useful products from waste material
reclaim.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: You can reclaim old boards and use them as shelves.
reclaim.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to get back something that has been taken from you or money that you have paid
reclaim.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: If a delivery date is not met, the buyer can reject the goods and reclaim any money paid.
Tax deducted on the dividends can be reclaimed.
reclaim.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to make an area of very wet or very dry land suitable for building or farming
reclaim.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: They plan to reclaim 1.5 million square kilometres of salt marsh.
reclaim.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to obtain useful products from waste material
reclaim.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The new recycling plant can reclaim 27,000 tons a year of discarded plastic.
